comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment:
This shouldn't be in place inside the SelectionResultPersistenceService which is where it really know about that instead of belongs to this service?
And in fact, shouldn't belong to a common constants class or be related with the SelectionResult object. It is hard to follow this or try to reused it in the future.

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: I agree. There is actually some code which is to be common between what Odyssey is working and this User Story. This constant is a part of such code which may be moved to common location after discussion. So for now we decided to make that as public constant in the LeavePlanSelectionService and use it. Let me know if that sounds ok.

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: Javacode says creates the selected leave plan, but it is not true, it updates nor creates, the selected leave plan.

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: Changed java doc to mention that it updated the Selected Leave Plan

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: Kind of weird says that the return value is undetermined, try to explain it as you did, but I'm not sure about saying that.

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: This particular piece pf method is from Odyssey, hence the java doc was specified by them. It just returns the enum full id of SelectionResultType.UNDETERMINED instance based on some logic.

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: It should be "Listener" instead of "Listner".

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: missing private

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: It should be on the top because it is a constant.

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: Missign javadoc parameter.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
quickAcceptAdjudicationOnSelectedLeavePlan() is complex and confusing.
Method names should be simple and clear. This could be: quickAcceptSelecteLeavePlan()

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: There is a method on leave request called isDecisionStatusPending(), use that.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Add methods onto LeaveRequest for isAdjudicationResultTypeAccepted() isAdjudicationResultTypeRejected()
rather than checking the ID in the widget here etc
Add tests for same on LeaveRequestTest

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
quickRejectAdjudicationOnSelectedLeavePlan is complex and confusing.
Method names should be simple and clear. This could be: quickRejectSelecteLeavePlan()

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: As above, too much logic in widget, hard to test.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: There is a method on leave request called isDecisionStatusPending(), use that.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: As above, create method on LeaveRequest

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: Cant we reuse the message defined in AbsenceMessageKeys.java, than hard coding it again here?

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
What exactly are we testing here? Is this a correct approach for a test?
Even if you do not call selectedLeavePlansForAbsenceCaseListviewWidget.quickRejectAdjudicationOnSelectedLeavePlan(); this test will pass. This test is not doing any real test, is just a placeholde to set something in code and test true = true.
Can we avaoid such tests or re write them correctely.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: What exactly are we testing here? Is this a correct approach for a test?

reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-1779 Selinium Test Creation For Wrap up.

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: The case name should be taken from the definition in case support.

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: There is already a method that search for an absence reason

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment:
This method and the one before should be overlaid to avoid duplication of data capture
As it stands this method creates a Party, adds an absence case and then adds an organisiation as with a role of employer. However the org is not created within this method, so therefore the method could not be used by other tests.
Try and create methods that live on the page objects and the support class just calls them

comments.author: Ramana Padapana
comments.comment: As Discussed with Tom , This method will be deleted once Employer is placed in Intake process

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: shouldn't hard code

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment:
this test should be part of the IntakeTest class. At this stage there is no need for it to be in its own package.
There is actually on going discussion about package names and test locations

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment:
Just to add, I've only just been able to run this test and I'm not sure what it is verifying. There is a hugae amount of data set up but the test just proceeds through Intake and logs out.
Give me a shout to discuss if you'd like

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: duplicate test name - while technically ok, causes problems with the logging and reporting

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: No need to give these 'meaningful names' - ok to use what's provided in the DTO. When something is defined like this it can confuse people as they expect it was done for a reason

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: not required if merged with IntakeTest

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: is this being used ? I'm not sure if mixing DTO's is a good idea.

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: this needs to live in a test class. The support methods should be short and concise

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: should be in test class so reusable if necessary

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: As per previous comment, this should live on the page object

comments.comment: removed and tested

comments.comment: Why this? Souldn't be getManager?

comments.author: Hiren Rana
Jose Martinez
comments.comment: Do we need this? This is a one to one rel as this is not different that the ones we have

comments.author: Jose Martinez
comments.comment: And, shoud we point this to an employment instead of a party?

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment:
Could we make use of ternary operators here: _return employment.getManagerItem() != null ?PartyFactory.getPartyManager().getPartyEntityForBusinessEntity(employment.getManagerItem()) : PartyFactory.getPartyManager().getNullPartyEntity(); _
Also suggest you refactor _PartyFactory.getPartyManager()_ into a variable

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: It is not just the if condition checking if manager exists the assign it to variable. There is now a message beign raised if employer is different for manager and employee. Though extracted to partymanager to a variable as suggested by you.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Same comment as before re: ternary operators

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Don't need variable...just put all in the return _return getPage().getParameters().getBusinessEntity(SearchPageParameters.SELECTED_OBJECT);_

comments.author: Jose Martinez
comments.comment: have you run ddlgeneration?

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: yes ddl generation was triggered no changes in the sql scripts.

comments.author: Jose Martinez
comments.comment: Shouldn't this be a part of a service?

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment:
Message scenario is not correctly implemented. There is story for the same. I have added the appropriate comment in story to refactor getManager() method and move it to correct service.
I have mentioned that to take this as improvement in jira FAB-3188

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Does this message have to be in this API? We seem to be doing other stuff here other than getting the manager as the API name suggests. So could we move this out?

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: Message scenario is not correctly implemented. There is story for the same. I have added the appropriate comment in story to move the message if required to correct service. I have mentioned that to take this as improvement in jira FAB-3188

comments.author: Killian Farrell
Hiren Rana
comments.comment: done. Will verify the same with Maura as well.

comments.author: Killian Farrell
comments.comment:
This if clause is a little ungainly, consider ectracting to a method
Should you be verifying that the managesr employment dates align with the employee?

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: No need to verify that manager employment dates align with Employee. Just check if the manager is currently employed with same employer. Later if the dates are not aligned there is Info message displayed on the Edit occupation screen.
